results.title: The Big Steal
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Timothy White, David Parker and Cascade Films
results.brief_description: Danny (Ben Mendelsohn) wants two things in his life: a Jaguar car and a relationship with the beautiful Joanna (Claudia Karvan).

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Nadia Tass, Timothy White, David Parker and Cascade Films
results.description: Danny (Ben Mendelsohn) wants two things in his life: a Jaguar car and a relationship with the beautiful Joanna (Claudia Karvan). A shonky car dealer, Farkas, takes Danny for a ride by selling him a Jaguar with a disaster area where the engine should be. But Danny manages to get his revenge on the sleazy Farkas as well as getting his dream date with Joanna. The inconsequential plot is secondary to the affectionate characterisation of the Western suburbs community in which Danny lives. The excellent cast also includes Steve Bisley.
description_for_label: Danny (Ben Mendelsohn) wants two things in his life: a Jaguar car and a relationship with the beautiful Joanna (Claudia Karvan). A shonky car dealer, Farkas, takes Danny for a ride by selling him a Jaguar with a disaster area where the engine should be. The inconsequential plot is secondary to the affectionate characterisation of the Western suburbs community in which Danny lives. The excellent cast also includes Steve Bisley.

results.title: Storm Boy
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Storm Boy is a 1976 Australian drama film based on the book of the same name by Colin Thiele, about a lonely boy and his pet pelicans living in a coastal wilderness with his reclusive father.

constellations_other.name: David Gulpilil
constellations_other.description: David Gulpilil is a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Gulpilil was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Henri Safran, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.description: Three characters live in isolation amidst the coastal sand dunes of the Coorong in southern South Australia. In a shack on the beach live Tom, a fisherman, and his young son; out amongst the dunes lives an Indigenous man, ‘Fingerbone Bill’, who forms a friendship with the boy, naming him ‘Storm Boy’. The story is conveyed with simplicity, with events being left unspoken and undetailed. The relationships between the characters, and the scenes where the boy and his pet pelican play together are subtly sketched. Burton’s photography effectively captures the wild beauty of the Coorong.
description_for_label: Three characters live in isolation amidst the coastal sand dunes of the Coorong in southern South Australia. In a shack on the beach live Tom, a fisherman, and his young son; out amongst the dunes lives an Indigenous man, ‘Fingerbone Bill’, who forms a friendship with the boy, naming him ‘Storm Boy’. The story is conveyed with simplicity, with events being left unspoken and undetailed. The relationships between the characters, and the scenes where the boy and his pet pelican play together are subtly sketched. Burton’s photography effectively captures the wild beauty of the Coorong.

results.title: Back to the future
results.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Neil Canton, Bob Gale and Amblin Entertainment
results.brief_description: Marty McFly (Michael J Fox) and Doc (Christopher Lloyd) have to save the present by going back to the future in this classic from the 1980s.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Zemeckis, Neil Canton, Bob Gale and Amblin Entertainment
results.description: Michael J. Fox stars as Marty McFly, transported by his friend Doc’s time machine to 1955. Marty rubs shoulders with a much younger version of his parents and sees a side to them he never knew existed. The only problem is that the car responsible for sending him back to 1955 has run out of the plutonium required to fuel the car. Marty must convince Doc that his idea for a time machine, conceived in 1955 was a reality in the 1980s. As a further complication, Marty must ensure his parents-to-be meet and fall in love.
description_for_label: Michael J. Fox stars as Marty McFly, transported by his friend Doc’s time machine to 1955. Marty rubs shoulders with a much younger version of his parents and sees a side to them he never knew existed. The only problem is that the car responsible for sending him back to 1955 has run out of the plutonium required to fuel the car. Marty must convince Doc that his idea for a time machine, conceived in 1955 was a reality in the 1980s. As a further complication, Marty must ensure his parents-to-be meet and fall in love.

results.title: The Devil's Playground
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi and Feature Film House Productions
results.brief_description: The Devil’s Playground is a 1976 Australian drama film written, produced and directed by Fred Schepisi. It is a semi-autobiographical film which tells the story of a boy growing up and going to school in a Catholic juniorate administered by De La Salle Brothers.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Fred Schepisi and Feature Film House Productions
results.description: The subject of a Catholic adolescence in a preparatory school for seminarians set in provincial Victoria, 1953, is substantially autobiographical which explains the engaging intimacy that Schepisi achieves in his first film. An unusual feature, given its subject, is the avoidance of a single point of view. It is not just the youths that are trapped by the Irish Catholic rigidities of the institution but the staff as well. The film does not question belief so much as the institutional distortions that are engendered by the imperatives of belief. Cast includes Arthur Dignam, Nick Tate, Simon Burke and Thomas Keneally.
description_for_label: The subject of a Catholic adolescence in a preparatory school for seminarians set in provincial Victoria, 1953, is substantially autobiographical which explains the engaging intimacy that Schepisi achieves in his first film. An unusual feature, given its subject, is the avoidance of a single point of view. results.title: Computer Space
results.brief_description: Computer Space is a video arcade game released in 1971 by Nutting Associates. Created by Nolan Bushnell and Ted Dabney, who would both later found Atari, Inc., it is generally accepted that it was the world’s first commercially sold coin-operated video game of any kind.

constellations_other.name: Arcades and AI
constellations_other.description: Using the godfather of computing, Alan Turing, as a starting point, this Constellation traces the evolution of AI representation on-screen and the way female androids, robots and holograms have been hyper sexualised.

results.description: Computer Space is a video arcade game released in 1971 by Nutting Associates. Created by Nolan Bushnell and Ted Dabney, who would both later found Atari, Inc., it is generally accepted that it was the world’s first commercially sold coin-operated video game of any kind, predating the Magnavox Odyssey’s release by six months, and Atari’s Pong by one year. It was first location tested at The Dutch Goose in August 1971, then debuted at the MOA show on October 15, 1971, and then officially released in November 1971. Though not commercially sold, the coin operated minicomputer-driven Galaxy Game appeared around the same time, located solely at Stanford University.
description_for_label: Computer Space is a video arcade game released in 1971 by Nutting Associates. Created by Nolan Bushnell and Ted Dabney, who would both later found Atari, Inc., it is generally accepted that it was the world’s first commercially sold coin-operated video game of any kind, predating the Magnavox Odyssey’s release by six months, and Atari’s Pong by one year. It was first location tested at The Dutch Goose in August 1971, then debuted at the MOA show on October 15, 1971, and then officially released in November 1971. Though not commercially sold, the coin operated minicomputer-driven Galaxy Game appeared around the same time, located solely at Stanford University.

results.title: Westworld
results.creator_credit: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Crichton, Paul N Lazarus III and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.description: Westworld combines solid entertainment and chilling topicality with a futuristic, suspenseful plot written by Michael Chrichton. Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines. Westworld is one of three giant theme parks built in what is left of America’s great outdoors where for $1,000 a day, tourists may indulge their highest and lowest appetites. Richard Benjamin and James Brolin are among the visitors to the futuristic theme park where the gun-hands and dance-hall girls are robots programmed to serve the guest’s whims and fantasises until something malfunctions in their circuitry. Yul Brynner delivers a remarkably eerie performance as a robot cowboy who develops a taste for the kill.
description_for_label: Westworld combines solid entertainment and chilling topicality with a futuristic, suspenseful plot written by Michael Chrichton. Set in the not too distant future, this is a vision of what may occur if man becomes too reliant on the infallibility of machines. results.title: Puberty Blues
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Margaret Kelly, Joan Long and Limelight Productions
results.brief_description: A popular coming-of-age story set on Cronulla Beach, where two high school girls, Debbie and Sue, have to navigate the chauvinism and sexism of the popular Greenhills surf gang to find their own selves.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Beresford, Margaret Kelly, Joan Long and Limelight Productions
results.description: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Debbie and Sue are accepted into the Greenhills’ gang, an elite group occupying a particular stretch of Cronulla beach. As surfie groupies Debbie and Sue are required to submit to male whims. Although the girls are proposed as subjects the film maintains a humorously ironic distance from the awfulness of the scene, particularly through the use of narration. The boys, collectively dominant, are individually consigned to the margins. Debbie and Sue are the real mates who ultimately break out of the confines of male-imposed rules. Cast includes: Nell Schofield, Jad Capelja, Geoff Rhoe, Tony Hughes. Based on the book by Cathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey.
description_for_label: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Debbie and Sue are accepted into the Greenhills’ gang, an elite group occupying a particular stretch of Cronulla beach. As surfie groupies Debbie and Sue are required to submit to male whims. results.title: Walking on Water
results.creator_credit: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: An impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family.

constellations_other.name: Tony Ayres
constellations_other.description: Charts the acclaimed career of Tony Ayres through his work in film and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.description: Impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family. Gavin is a gay man living in Sydney when he succumbs to illness; his two best friends, Anna and Charlie, who assist his death in its final stages, grieve inconsolably, blocking their pain and memories with drugs, alcohol and sex. Whilst Charlie’s relationship with his boyfriend sours, Anna embarks on an affair, whilst shifting into controlling over-drive. This puts her in conflict with Gavin’s mother, who finds her role usurped. Despite the morbid subject matter “Walking on water” relishes in gallows humour, showing that even in death, there is life. Brilliant central performances from Vince Colosimo and Maria Theodorakis, coupled with intelligent scripting make this a memorable experience.
description_for_label: Impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family. Gavin is a gay man living in Sydney when he succumbs to illness; his two best friends, Anna and Charlie, who assist his death in its final stages, grieve inconsolably, blocking their pain and memories with drugs, alcohol and sex. Whilst Charlie’s relationship with his boyfriend sours, Anna embarks on an affair, whilst shifting into controlling over-drive. This puts her in conflict with Gavin’s mother, who finds her role usurped. Despite the morbid subject matter “Walking on water” relishes in gallows humour, showing that even in death, there is life. Brilliant central performances from Vince Colosimo and Maria Theodorakis, coupled with intelligent scripting make this a memorable experience.

results.title: Star Wars Battlefront
results.brief_description: Star Wars: Battelfront allows players to blast or lightsabre their way through some of the most iconic battles from the Star Wars universe.

constellations_other.name: Action, emotion and videogames
constellations_other.description: More and more, videogames are beginning to favour emotion as much as action, just like their film and TV cousins.

results.description:
In 2004, the original Star Wars: Battlefront came onto the scene and took gamers – and Star Wars fans – by surprise. It was an ambitious action shooter that gave players the opportunity to step into the shoes of their favorite Star Wars characters, pilot quintessential Star Wars vehicles, and relive classic Star Wars battles.

Fast forward nearly 10 years and gamers still have many of those same Star Wars gaming fantasies – but now they wish to experience those larger-than-life battles in magnificent high definition, with all of the amazing special effects, vehicle physics and gameplay intensity that the next-generation has to offer.

Star Wars Battlefront, developed by DICE on Frostbite 3, will surprise and delight fans yet again with a new experience inside this beloved universe made with our signature DICE craftsmanship and commitment to excellence.
description_for_label:
In 2004, the original Star Wars: Battlefront came onto the scene and took gamers – and Star Wars fans – by surprise. It was an ambitious action shooter that gave players the opportunity to step into the shoes of their favorite Star Wars characters, pilot quintessential Star Wars vehicles, and relive classic Star Wars battles.

Fast forward nearly 10 years and gamers still have many of those same Star Wars gaming fantasies – but now they wish to experience those larger-than-life battles in magnificent high definition, with all of the amazing special effects, vehicle physics and gameplay intensity that the next-generation has to offer.

Star Wars Battlefront, developed by DICE on Frostbite 3, will surprise and delight fans yet again with a new experience inside this beloved universe made with our signature DICE craftsmanship and commitment to excellence.

results.title: Walkabout
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Si Litvinoff and Max L. Raab - Si Litvinoff Films
results.brief_description: Nicolas Roeg’s lyrical tale about a sister and her young brother left stranded in the Australian outback having survived their father’s attempt to destroy the family. They’re rescued by a young Aboriginal man (David Gulpilil) who has journeyed into the vast desert on his walkabout - a tribal initiation into manhood.

constellations_other.name: David Gulpilil
constellations_other.description: David Gulpilil is a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Gulpilil was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicolas Roeg, Si Litvinoff and Max L. Raab - Si Litvinoff Films
results.description: Nicolas Roeg’s lyrical tale about a sister (Jenny Agutter) and her young brother (Lucien John) left stranded in the Australian outback having survived their father’s attempt to destroy the family. They are rescued by a young Aboriginal man (David Gulpilil) who has journeyed into the vast desert on his walkabout - a tribal initiation into manhood. During their journey Gulpilil courts the young woman, though in her incomprehension she rejects his advances. The vision of paradise lost presented with an often surreal intensity is that of a European outsider, who sees white history as invasive and deeply destructive. Also stars John Meillon, Robert McDara, Pete Carver, John Illingsworth, Hilary Bamberger, Barry Donnelly, Noelene Brown and Carlo Machini. Screenplay by Edward Bond, based on the novel by James Vance Marshall. Edited by Antony Gibbs and Alan Pattillo. Music composed and conducted by John Barry.
description_for_label: Nicolas Roeg’s lyrical tale about a sister (Jenny Agutter) and her young brother (Lucien John) left stranded in the Australian outback having survived their father’s attempt to destroy the family.
